Provides classes for different mirror surfaces, which are types of optics.

Think of these as the z-coordinates on top of the x-y-grid provided by the ART.ModuleSupport.Support.

Also provides the function ReflectionMirrorRayList that returns the rays reflected on the mirror. Rays that do not hit the support are not propagated any further.

Created in 2019

@author: Anthony Guillaume and Stefan Haessler and Semptum and Charles Bourassin-Bouchet

   1"""
   2Provides classes for different mirror surfaces, which are types of optics.
   3
   4Think of these as the z-coordinates on top of the x-y-grid provided by the ART.ModuleSupport.Support.
   5
   6Also provides the function *ReflectionMirrorRayList* that returns the rays reflected on
   7the mirror. Rays that do not hit the support are not propagated any further.
   8
   9![Illustration the Mirror-class.](Mirror.svg)
  10
  11
  12
  13Created in 2019
  14
  15@author: Anthony Guillaume and Stefan Haessler and Semptum and Charles Bourassin-Bouchet
  16"""
  17# %% Modules
  18import ARTcore.ModuleGeometry as mgeo
  19import ARTcore.ModuleSupport as msup
  20import ARTcore.ModuleOpticalElement as moe
  21from ARTcore.ModuleDependencyConstructor import DepSolver
  22
  23import numpy as np
  24from enum import Enum
  25import math
  26from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
  27import logging
  28
  29logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
  30
  31# %%
  32
  33class Curvature(Enum):
  34    CONVEX = -1
  35    FLAT = 0
  36    CONCAVE = 1
  37
  38class Mirror(moe.OpticalElement):
  39    """Abstract base class for mirrors."""
  40    def __init__(self):
  41        pass
  42
  43    @abstractmethod
  44    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
  45        pass
  46
  47    @abstractmethod
  48    def get_local_normal(self, Point: np.ndarray):
  49        pass
  50
  51    @abstractmethod
  52    def get_centre(self):
  53        v = self.centre_ref-self.r0
  54        return self.r0 + (self.q*np.quaternion(0,*v)*self.q.conj()).imag + self.r
  55
  56    @abstractmethod
  57    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint):
  58        pass
  59
  60def _IntersectionRayMirror(PointMirror, ListPointIntersectionMirror):
  61    """When the ray has pierced the mirror twice, select the first point, otherwise just keep that one."""
  62    if len(ListPointIntersectionMirror) == 2:
  63        return mgeo.ClosestPoint(
  64            PointMirror,
  65            ListPointIntersectionMirror[0],
  66            ListPointIntersectionMirror[1],
  67        )
  68    elif len(ListPointIntersectionMirror) == 1:
  69        return ListPointIntersectionMirror[0]
  70    else:
  71        return None
  72
  73
  74# %%############################################################################
  75class MirrorPlane(Mirror):
  76    """
  77    A plane mirror.
  78
  79    Attributes
  80    ----------
  81        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
  82            Mirror support
  83        type : str = 'Plane Mirror'
  84            Human readable mirror type
  85    Methods
  86    -------
  87        MirrorPlane.get_normal(Point)
  88
  89        MirrorPlane.get_centre()
  90
  91        MirrorPlane.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
  92    """
  93
  94    def __init__(self, Support, **kwargs):
  95        """
  96        Create a plane mirror on a given Support.
  97
  98        Parameters
  99        ----------
 100            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 101
 102        """
 103        self.support = Support
 104        self.type = "Plane Mirror"
 105        self.curvature = Curvature.FLAT
 106
 107        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 108        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
 109
 110        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 111        self.centre_ref = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 112        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
 113        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
 114
 115        self._positionned = False
 116        self._oriented = False
 117        if "position" in kwargs:
 118            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
 119            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
 120                logger.debug("Defining position of plane mirror during creation")
 121                self._r = NewPosition - self._basepoint_ref
 122                self._positionned = True
 123        if "orientation" in kwargs:
 124            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
 125            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
 126                logger.debug("Defining orientation of plane mirror during creation")
 127                self._q = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
 128                self._oriented = True
 129        super().__init__()
 130        
 131    def __repr__(self):
 132        match type(self.support):
 133            case msup.SupportRound:
 134                shape = "Round Plane Mirror"
 135                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius}"
 136            case msup.SupportRectangle:
 137                shape = "Rectangular Plane Mirror"
 138                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY}"
 139            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
 140                shape = "Rectangular holey Plane Mirror"
 141                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY}, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole}"
 142            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
 143                shape = "Rectangular holey Plane Mirror with rectangular hole"
 144                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY}, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY}"
 145            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
 146                shape = "Round holey Plane Mirror"
 147                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius}, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole}"
 148            case _:
 149                shape = "Plane Mirror"
 150        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
 151        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
 152        if self._positionned:
 153            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
 154        else:
 155            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
 156        pretty_str+="\t-"
 157        if self._oriented:
 158            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
 159        else:
 160            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
 161        return pretty_str
 162
 163    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
 164        """Return the intersection point between Ray and the xy-plane."""
 165        t = -Ray.point[2] / Ray.vector[2]
 166        Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
 167        if t > 0 and self.support._IncludeSupport(Intersect):
 168            PointIntersection = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
 169        else:
 170            PointIntersection = None
 171
 172        return PointIntersection
 173
 174    def get_local_normal(self, Point: np.ndarray):
 175        """Return normal unit vector in point 'Point' on the plane mirror."""
 176        Normal = np.array([0, 0, 1])
 177        return Normal
 178
 179    def get_centre(self):
 180        """Return 3D coordinates of the point on the mirror surface at the center of its support."""
 181        return np.array([0, 0, 0])
 182
 183    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint: int, **kwargs):
 184        """
 185        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
 186
 187        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
 188        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
 189        """
 190        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
 191        ListCoordXYZ = []
 192        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
 193        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
 194        if E:
 195            contours, contour_edges = contours
 196        ListCoordXY = contours + self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
 197        for k in ListCoordXY:
 198            z = 0
 199            ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([k[0], k[1], z]))
 200        if E:
 201            return ListCoordXYZ, contour_edges
 202
 203        return ListCoordXYZ
 204

 207class MirrorSpherical(Mirror):
 208    """
 209    Spherical mirror surface with eqn. $x^2 + y^2 + z^2  = R^2$, where $R$ is the radius.
 210
 211    ![Illustration of a spherical mirror.](sphericalmirror.svg)
 212
 213    Attributes
 214    ----------
 215        radius : float
 216            Radius of curvature. A postive value for concave mirror, a negative value for a convex mirror.
 217
 218        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 219
 220        type : str SphericalCC Mirror' or SphericalCX Mirror'
 221
 222    Methods
 223    -------
 224        MirrorSpherical.get_normal(Point)
 225
 226        MirrorSpherical.get_centre()
 227
 228        MirrorSpherical.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
 229
 230    """
 231
 232    def __init__(self, Support, Radius, **kwargs):
 233        """
 234        Construct a spherical mirror.
 235
 236        Parameters
 237        ----------
 238            Radius : float
 239                The radius of curvature in mm. A postive value for concave mirror, a negative value for a convex mirror.
 240
 241            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 242
 243        """
 244        if Radius==np.inf or Radius==-np.inf:
 245            logger.info("Requested spherical mirror has infinite radius, using MirrorPlane instead.")
 246            return MirrorPlane(Support, **kwargs)
 247        elif Radius < 0:
 248            self.type = "SphericalCX Mirror"
 249            self.curvature = Curvature.CONVEX
 250            self.radius = -Radius
 251        else:
 252            self.type = "SphericalCC Mirror"
 253            self.curvature = Curvature.CONCAVE
 254            self.radius = Radius
 255        self.support = Support
 256
 257        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 258        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
 259
 260        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.radius])
 261        self.centre_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.radius])
 262        self.sphere_center_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, 0])
 263        self.focus_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.radius/2])
 264
 265        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
 266        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
 267        self.towards_focus_ref = mgeo.Normalize(self.focus_ref - self.centre_ref)
 268
 269        self._oriented = False
 270        self._positionned = False
 271        if "position" in kwargs:
 272            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
 273            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
 274                logger.debug("Defining position of spherical mirror during creation")
 275                self._r = NewPosition - self._basepoint_ref
 276                self._positionned = True
 277        if "orientation" in kwargs:
 278            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
 279            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
 280                logger.debug("Defining orientation of spherical mirror during creation")
 281                self._q = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
 282                self._oriented = True
 283        super().__init__()
 284
 285    def __repr__(self):
 286        match type(self.support):
 287            case msup.SupportRound:
 288                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
 289                size = f"Support Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, ROC: {self.radius}"
 290            case msup.SupportRectangle:
 291                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"
 292                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm"
 293            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
 294                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type}"
 295                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm"
 296            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
 297                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type} with rectangular hole"
 298                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm"
 299            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
 300                shape = f"Round holey {self.type}"
 301                size = f"Support Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, , ROC: {self.radius}"
 302            case _:
 303                shape = f"{self.type}"
 304                size = "Custom size"
 305        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
 306        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
 307        if self._positionned:
 308            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
 309        else:
 310            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
 311        pretty_str+="\t-"
 312        if self._oriented:
 313            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
 314        else:
 315            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
 316        return pretty_str
 317
 318    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
 319        """Return the intersection point between the ray and the sphere."""
 320        a = np.dot(Ray.vector, Ray.vector)
 321        b = 2 * np.dot(Ray.vector, Ray.point)
 322        c = np.dot(Ray.point, Ray.point) - self.radius**2
 323
 324        Solution = mgeo.SolverQuadratic(a, b, c)
 325        Solution = mgeo.KeepPositiveSolution(Solution)
 326
 327        ListPointIntersection = []
 328        for t in Solution:
 329            Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
 330            if Intersect[2] < 0 and self.support._IncludeSupport(Intersect):
 331                ListPointIntersection.append(Intersect)
 332
 333        return _IntersectionRayMirror(Ray.point, ListPointIntersection)
 334
 335    def get_local_normal(self, Point):
 336        """Return the normal unit vector on the spherical surface at point Point."""
 337        return mgeo.Normalize(-Point)
 338
 339    def get_centre(self):
 340        """Return 3D coordinates of the point on the mirror surface at the center of its support."""
 341        return np.array([0, 0, -self.radius])
 342
 343    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
 344        """
 345        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
 346
 347        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
 348        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
 349        """
 350        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
 351        ListCoordXYZ = []
 352        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
 353        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
 354        if E:
 355            contours, contour_edges = contours
 356        ListCoordXY = contours + self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
 357        for k in ListCoordXY:
 358            z = -np.sqrt(self.radius**2 - (k[0] ** 2 + k[1] ** 2))
 359            ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([k[0], k[1], z]))
 360        if E:
 361            return ListCoordXYZ, contour_edges
 362        return ListCoordXYZ
 363

 366class MirrorParabolic(Mirror):
 367    r"""
 368    A paraboloid with vertex at the origin $O=[0,0,0]$ and symmetry axis z:
 369    $z = \frac{1}{4f}[x^2 + y^2]$ where $f$ is the focal lenght of the *mother*
 370    parabola (i.e. measured from its center at $O$ to the focal point $F$).
 371
 372    The center of the support is shifted along the x-direction by the off-axis distance $x_c$.
 373    This leads to an *effective focal length* $f_\mathrm{eff}$, measured from the shifted center
 374    of the support  $P$ to the focal point $F$.
 375    It is related to the mother focal length by $f = f_\\mathrm{eff} \cos^2(\alpha/2) $,
 376    or equivalently $ p = 2f = f_\mathrm{eff} (1+\\cos\\alpha)$, where $\\alpha$
 377    is the off-axis angle, and $p = 2f$ is called the semi latus rectum.
 378
 379    Another useful relationship is that between the off-axis distance and the resulting
 380    off-axis angle: $x_c = 2 f \tan(\alpha/2)$.
 381
 382
 383    ![Illustration of a parabolic mirror.](parabola.svg)
 384
 385    Attributes
 386    ----------
 387        offaxisangle : float
 388            Off-axis angle of the parabola. Modifying this also updates p, keeping feff constant.
 389            Attention: The off-axis angle must be *given in degrees*, but is stored and will be *returned in radian* !
 390
 391        feff : float
 392            Effective focal length of the parabola in mm. Modifying this also updates p, keeping offaxisangle constant.
 393
 394        p : float
 395            Semi latus rectum of the parabola in mm. Modifying this also updates feff, keeping offaxisangle constant.
 396
 397        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 398
 399        type : str 'Parabolic Mirror'.
 400
 401    Methods
 402    -------
 403        MirrorParabolic.get_normal(Point)
 404
 405        MirrorParabolic.get_centre()
 406
 407        MirrorParabolic.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
 408
 409    """
 410
 411    def __init__(self, Support,
 412                FocalEffective: float=None,
 413                OffAxisAngle: float = None,
 414                FocalParent: float = None,
 415                RadiusParent: float = None,
 416                OffAxisDistance: float = None,
 417                **kwargs):
 418        """
 419        Initialise a Parabolic mirror.
 420
 421        Parameters
 422        ----------
 423            FocalEffective : float
 424                Effective focal length of the parabola in mm.
 425
 426            OffAxisAngle : float
 427                Off-axis angle *in degrees* of the parabola.
 428
 429            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 430
 431        """
 432        if FocalEffective==np.inf or FocalEffective==-np.inf:
 433            logger.info("Requested parabolic mirror has infinite focal, using MirrorPlane instead.")
 434            return MirrorPlane(Support, **kwargs)
 435        
 436        self.curvature = Curvature.CONCAVE
 437        self.support = Support
 438        self.type = "Parabolic Mirror"
 439
 440        parameter_calculator = OAP_calculator()
 441        values,steps = parameter_calculator.calculate_values(verify_consistency=True,
 442                                                             fs=FocalEffective,
 443                                                             theta=OffAxisAngle,
 444                                                             fp=FocalParent,
 445                                                             Rc=RadiusParent,
 446                                                             OAD=OffAxisDistance)
 447        self._offaxisangle = values["theta"]
 448        self._feff = values["fs"]
 449        self._p = values["p"]
 450        self._offaxisdistance = values["OAD"]
 451        self._fparent = values["fp"]
 452        self._rparent = values["Rc"]
 453
 454        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 455        """Offset of the basepoint."""
 456        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
 457        """Orientation of the mirror."""
 458
 459        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([-self._offaxisdistance, 0, self._p/2 - self.feff * np.cos(self.offaxisangle)])
 460        """Basepoint of the mirror in its own reference frame. Corresponds to its optical center"""
 461        self.centre_ref = np.array([-self._offaxisdistance, 0, self._p/2 - self.feff * np.cos(self.offaxisangle)])
 462        """Optical center of the mirror"""
 463        self.focus_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.feff])
 464        """Focus of the mirror in its own reference frame."""
 465        self.along_focusing_ref = mgeo.Normalize(self.focus_ref-self.centre_ref)
 466        """Unit vector along the focusing direction in the mirror reference frame."""
 467        self.along_collimated_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
 468        """Unit vector along the collimated direction in the mirror reference frame."""
 469        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
 470        """Normal vector of the support in the mirror reference frame."""
 471        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
 472        """Major axis of the mirror in the mirror reference frame."""
 473        
 474        self._oriented = False
 475        """Is the mirror oriented?"""
 476        self._positionned = False
 477        """Is the mirror positionned?"""
 478
 479        if "position" in kwargs:
 480            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
 481            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
 482                logger.debug("Defining position of plane mirror during creation")
 483                self._r = NewPosition - self._basepoint_ref
 484                self._positionned = True
 485        if "orientation" in kwargs:
 486            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
 487            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
 488                logger.debug("Defining orientation of plane mirror during creation")
 489                self._q = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
 490                self._oriented = True
 491        super().__init__()
 492
 493
 494    def __repr__(self):
 495        match type(self.support):
 496            case msup.SupportRound:
 497                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
 498                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"
 499            case msup.SupportRectangle:
 500                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"
 501                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"
 502            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
 503                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type}"
 504                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"
 505            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
 506                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type} with rectangular hole"
 507                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"
 508            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
 509                shape = f"Round holey {self.type}"
 510                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"
 511            case _:
 512                shape = f"{self.type}"
 513                size = "Custom size"
 514        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
 515        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
 516        if self._positionned:
 517            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
 518        else:
 519            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
 520        pretty_str+="\t-"
 521        if self._oriented:
 522            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
 523        else:
 524            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
 525        return pretty_str
 526    
 527    @property
 528    def offaxisangle(self):
 529        return self._offaxisangle
 530
 531    @offaxisangle.setter
 532    def offaxisangle(self, OffAxisAngle):
 533        self._offaxisangle = np.deg2rad(OffAxisAngle)  # store (and later return) in radians!
 534        self._p = self._feff * (1 + np.cos(self._offaxisangle))  # make sure to always update p
 535
 536    @property
 537    def feff(self):
 538        """Get effective focal length."""
 539        return self._feff
 540
 541    @feff.setter
 542    def feff(self, FocalEffective):
 543        self._feff = FocalEffective
 544        self._p = self._feff * (
 545            1 + np.cos(self._offaxisangle)
 546        )  # make sure to always update p
 547
 548    @property
 549    def p(self):
 550        """Get simi-latus-rectum."""
 551        return self._p
 552
 553    @p.setter
 554    def p(self, SemiLatusRectum):
 555        self._p = SemiLatusRectum
 556        self._feff = self._p / (
 557            1 + np.cos(self._offaxisangle)
 558        )  # make sure to always update feff
 559
 560    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
 561        """Return the intersection point between the ray and the parabola."""
 562        ux, uy, uz = Ray.vector
 563        xA, yA, zA = Ray.point
 564
 565        da = ux**2 + uy**2
 566        db = 2 * (ux * xA + uy * yA) - 2 * self._p * uz
 567        dc = xA**2 + yA**2 - 2 * self._p * zA
 568
 569        Solution = mgeo.SolverQuadratic(da, db, dc)
 570        Solution = mgeo.KeepPositiveSolution(Solution)
 571
 572        ListPointIntersection = []
 573        for t in Solution:
 574            Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
 575            if self.support._IncludeSupport(Intersect - self.get_centre()):
 576                ListPointIntersection.append(Intersect)
 577
 578        return _IntersectionRayMirror(Ray.point, ListPointIntersection)
 579
 580    def get_local_normal(self, Point):
 581        """Return the normal unit vector on the paraboloid surface at point Point."""
 582        Gradient = np.zeros(3)
 583        Gradient[0] = -Point[0]
 584        Gradient[1] = -Point[1]
 585        Gradient[2] = self._p
 586        return mgeo.Normalize(Gradient)
 587
 588    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
 589        """
 590        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
 591
 592        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
 593        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
 594        """
 595        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
 596        ListCoordXYZ = []
 597        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
 598        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
 599        if E:
 600            contours, contour_edges = contours
 601        ListCoordXY = contours + self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
 602        xc = self.feff * np.sin(self.offaxisangle)
 603        for k in ListCoordXY:
 604            z = ((k[0] + xc) ** 2 + k[1] ** 2) / 2 / self._p
 605            ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([k[0] + xc, k[1], z]))
 606        if E:
 607            return ListCoordXYZ, contour_edges
 608        return ListCoordXYZ
 609

 611# %%############################################################################
 612class MirrorToroidal(Mirror):
 613    r"""
 614    Toroidal mirror surface with eqn.$(\sqrt{x^2+z^2}-R)^2 + y^2 = r^2$ where $R$ and $r$ the major and minor radii.
 615
 616    ![Illustration of a toroidal mirror.](toroidal.svg)
 617
 618    Attributes
 619    ----------
 620        majorradius : float
 621            Major radius of the toroid in mm.
 622
 623        minorradius : float
 624            Minor radius of the toroid in mm.
 625
 626        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 627
 628        type : str 'Toroidal Mirror'.
 629
 630    Methods
 631    -------
 632        MirrorToroidal.get_normal(Point)
 633
 634        MirrorToroidal.get_centre()
 635
 636        MirrorToroidal.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
 637
 638    """
 639
 640    def __init__(self, Support, MajorRadius, MinorRadius, **kwargs):
 641        """
 642        Construct a toroidal mirror.
 643
 644        Parameters
 645        ----------
 646            MajorRadius : float
 647                Major radius of the toroid in mm.
 648
 649            MinorRadius : float
 650                Minor radius of the toroid in mm.
 651
 652            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 653
 654        """
 655        self.support = Support
 656        self.type = "Toroidal Mirror"
 657
 658        self.majorradius = MajorRadius
 659        self.minorradius = MinorRadius
 660
 661        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 662        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
 663
 664        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([0.0, 0.0, -MajorRadius - MinorRadius])
 665        self.centre_ref = np.array([0.0, 0.0, -MajorRadius - MinorRadius])
 666
 667        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
 668        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
 669
 670
 671        self._positionned = False
 672        self._oriented = False
 673        if "orientation" in kwargs:
 674            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
 675            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
 676                logger.debug("Defining orientation of parabolic mirror during creation")
 677                self._orientation = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
 678                self._oriented = True
 679        if "position" in kwargs:
 680            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
 681            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
 682                logger.debug("Defining position of parabolic mirror during creation")
 683                self._position = NewPosition
 684                self._positionned = True
 685        super().__init__()
 686
 687
 688    def __repr__(self):
 689        match type(self.support):
 690            case msup.SupportRound:
 691                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
 692                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, major radius: {self.majorradius} mm, minor radius: {self.minorradius} mm"
 693            case msup.SupportRectangle:
 694                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"
 695                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, major radius: {self.majorradius} mm, minor radius: {self.minorradius} mm"
 696            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
 697                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type}"
 698                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, major radius: {self.majorradius} mm, minor radius: {self.minorradius} mm"
 699            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
 700                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type} with rectangular hole"
 701                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm, major radius: {self.majorradius} mm, minor radius: {self.minorradius} mm"
 702            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
 703                shape = f"Round holey {self.type}"
 704                size = f"Radius: {self.majorradius} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, minor radius: {self.minorradius} mm"
 705            case _:
 706                shape = f"{self.type}"
 707                size = "Custom size"
 708        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
 709        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
 710        if self._positionned:
 711            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
 712        else:
 713            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
 714        pretty_str+="\t-"
 715        if self._oriented:
 716            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
 717        else:
 718            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
 719        return pretty_str
 720
 721    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
 722        """Return the intersection point between Ray and the toroidal mirror surface. The intersection points are given in the reference frame of the mirror"""
 723        ux = Ray.vector[0]
 724        uz = Ray.vector[2]
 725        xA = Ray.point[0]
 726        zA = Ray.point[2]
 727
 728        G = 4.0 * self.majorradius**2 * (ux**2 + uz**2)
 729        H = 8.0 * self.majorradius**2 * (ux * xA + uz * zA)
 730        I = 4.0 * self.majorradius**2 * (xA**2 + zA**2)
 731        J = np.dot(Ray.vector, Ray.vector)
 732        K = 2.0 * np.dot(Ray.vector, Ray.point)
 733        L = (
 734            np.dot(Ray.point, Ray.point)
 735            + self.majorradius**2
 736            - self.minorradius**2
 737        )
 738
 739        a = J**2
 740        b = 2 * J * K
 741        c = 2 * J * L + K**2 - G
 742        d = 2 * K * L - H
 743        e = L**2 - I
 744
 745        Solution = mgeo.SolverQuartic(a, b, c, d, e)
 746        Solution = mgeo.KeepPositiveSolution(Solution)
 747
 748        ListPointIntersection = []
 749        for t in Solution:
 750            Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
 751            if Intersect[2] < -self.majorradius and self.support._IncludeSupport(
 752                Intersect
 753            ):  # For realistic mirror
 754                ListPointIntersection.append(Intersect)
 755
 756        return _IntersectionRayMirror(Ray.point, ListPointIntersection)
 757
 758    def get_local_normal(self, Point):
 759        """Return the normal unit vector on the toroidal surface at point Point in the reference frame of the mirror"""
 760        x = Point[0]
 761        y = Point[1]
 762        z = Point[2]
 763        A = self.majorradius**2 - self.minorradius**2
 764
 765        Gradient = np.zeros(3)
 766        Gradient[0] = (
 767            4 * (x**3 + x * y**2 + x * z**2 + x * A)
 768            - 8 * x * self.majorradius**2
 769        )
 770        Gradient[1] = 4 * (y**3 + y * x**2 + y * z**2 + y * A)
 771        Gradient[2] = (
 772            4 * (z**3 + z * x**2 + z * y**2 + z * A)
 773            - 8 * z * self.majorradius**2
 774        )
 775
 776        return mgeo.Normalize(-Gradient)
 777
 778    def get_centre(self):
 779        """Return 3D coordinates of the point on the mirror surface at the center of its support in the reference frame of the mirror"""
 780        return np.array([0, 0, -self.majorradius - self.minorradius])
 781
 782    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
 783        """
 784        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
 785
 786        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
 787        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
 788        """
 789        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
 790        ListCoordXYZ = []
 791        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
 792        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
 793        if E:
 794            contours, contour_edges = contours
 795        ListCoordXY = contours + self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
 796        for k in ListCoordXY:
 797            z = -np.sqrt(
 798                (np.sqrt(self.minorradius**2 - k[1] ** 2) + self.majorradius)
 799                ** 2
 800                - k[0] ** 2
 801            )
 802            ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([k[0], k[1], z]))
 803        if E:
 804            return ListCoordXYZ, contour_edges
 805        return ListCoordXYZ
 806
 807
 808# %%
 809
 810
 811def ReturnOptimalToroidalRadii(
 812    Focal: float, AngleIncidence: float
 813) -> (float, float):
 814    """
 815    Get optimal parameters for a toroidal mirror.
 816
 817    Useful helper function to get the optimal major and minor radii for a toroidal mirror to achieve a
 818    focal length 'Focal' with an angle of incidence 'AngleIncidence' and with vanishing astigmatism.
 819
 820    Parameters
 821    ----------
 822        Focal : float
 823            Focal length in mm.
 824
 825        AngleIncidence : int
 826            Angle of incidence in degrees.
 827
 828    Returns
 829    -------
 830        OptimalMajorRadius, OptimalMinorRadius : float, float.
 831    """
 832    AngleIncidenceRadian = AngleIncidence * np.pi / 180
 833    OptimalMajorRadius = (
 834        2
 835        * Focal
 836        * (1 / np.cos(AngleIncidenceRadian) - np.cos(AngleIncidenceRadian))
 837    )
 838    OptimalMinorRadius = 2 * Focal * np.cos(AngleIncidenceRadian)
 839    return OptimalMajorRadius, OptimalMinorRadius
 840
 841
 842# %%############################################################################
 843class MirrorEllipsoidal(Mirror):
 844    """
 845    Ellipdoidal mirror surface with eqn. $(x/a)^2 + (y/b)^2 + (z/b)^2 = 1$, where $a$ and $b$ are semi major and semi minor axes.
 846
 847    ![Illustration of a ellipsoidal mirror.](ellipsoid.svg)
 848
 849    Attributes
 850    ----------
 851        a : float
 852            Semi major axis of the ellipsoid in mm.
 853
 854        b : float
 855            Semi minor axis of the ellipsoid in mm.
 856
 857        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 858
 859        type : str 'Ellipsoidal Mirror'.
 860
 861    Methods
 862    -------
 863        MirrorEllipsoidal.get_normal(Point)
 864
 865        MirrorEllipsoidal.get_centre()
 866
 867        MirrorEllipsoidal.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
 868
 869    """
 870
 871    def __init__(
 872        self,
 873        Support,
 874        SemiMajorAxis=None,
 875        SemiMinorAxis=None,
 876        OffAxisAngle=None,
 877        f_object=None,
 878        f_image=None,
 879        IncidenceAngle=None,
 880        Magnification=None,
 881        DistanceObjectImage=None,
 882        Eccentricity=None,
 883        **kwargs,
 884    ):
 885        """
 886        Generate an ellipsoidal mirror with given parameters.
 887
 888        The angles are given in degrees but converted to radians for internal calculations.
 889        You can specify the semi-major and semi-minor axes, the off-axis angle, the object and image focal distances or some other parameters.
 890        The constructor uses a magic calculator to determine the missing parameters.
 891
 892        Parameters
 893        ----------
 894        Support : TYPE
 895            ART.ModuleSupport.Support.
 896        SemiMajorAxis : float (optional)
 897            Semi major axis of the ellipsoid in mm..
 898        SemiMinorAxis : float (optional)
 899            Semi minor axis of the ellipsoid in mm..
 900        OffAxisAngle : float (optional)
 901            Off-axis angle of the mirror in mm. Defined as the angle at the centre of the mirror between the two foci..
 902        f_object : float (optional)
 903            Object focal distance in mm.
 904        f_image : float (optional)
 905            Image focal distance in mm.
 906        IncidenceAngle : float  (optional)
 907            Angle of incidence in degrees.
 908        Magnification : float  (optional)
 909            Magnification.
 910        DistanceObjectImage : float  (optional)
 911            Distance between object and image in mm.
 912        Eccentricity : float  (optional)
 913            Eccentricity of the ellipsoid.
 914        """
 915        self.type = "Ellipsoidal Mirror"
 916        self.support = Support
 917        self.a = None
 918        self.b = None
 919        self._offaxisangle = None
 920        parameter_calculator = EllipsoidalMirrorCalculator()
 921        values, steps = parameter_calculator.calculate_values(verify_consistency=True, 
 922                                                              f1=f_object, 
 923                                                              f2=f_image, 
 924                                                              a=SemiMajorAxis, 
 925                                                              b=SemiMinorAxis, 
 926                                                              offset_angle=OffAxisAngle,
 927                                                              incidence_angle=IncidenceAngle,
 928                                                              m=Magnification,
 929                                                              l=DistanceObjectImage,
 930                                                              e=Eccentricity)
 931        self._position = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
 932        self._positionned = False
 933        if "position" in kwargs:
 934            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
 935            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
 936                logger.debug("Defining position of parabolic mirror during creation")
 937                self._position = NewPosition
 938                self._positionned = True
 939        self._orientation = np.quaternion(1)
 940        self._oriented = False
 941        if "orientation" in kwargs:
 942            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
 943            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
 944                logger.debug("Defining orientation of parabolic mirror during creation")
 945                self._orientation = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
 946                self._oriented = True
 947        self.oe_frame_normal = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
 948        self.oe_frame_majoraxis = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
 949        super().__init__()
 950
 951    def __repr__(self):
 952        match type(self.support):
 953            case msup.SupportRound:
 954                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
 955                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, semi-major axis: {self.a} mm, semi-minor axis: {self.b} mm"
 956            case msup.SupportRectangle:
 957                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"
 958                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, semi-major axis: {self.a} mm, semi-minor axis: {self.b} mm"
 959            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
 960                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type}"
 961                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, semi-major axis: {self.a} mm, semi-minor axis: {self.b} mm"
 962            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
 963                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type} with rectangular hole"
 964                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm, semi-major axis: {self.a} mm, semi-minor axis: {self.b} mm"
 965            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
 966                shape = f"Round holey {self.type}"
 967                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, semi-major axis: {self.a} mm, semi-minor axis: {self.b} mm"
 968            case _:
 969                shape = f"{self.type}"
 970                size = "Custom size"
 971        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
 972        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
 973        if self._positionned:
 974            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
 975        else:
 976            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
 977        pretty_str+="\t-"
 978        if self._oriented:
 979            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
 980        else:
 981            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
 982        return pretty_str
 983
 984
 985    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
 986        """Return the intersection point between Ray and the ellipsoidal mirror surface."""
 987        ux, uy, uz = Ray.vector
 988        xA, yA, zA = Ray.point
 989
 990        da = (uy**2 + uz**2) / self.b**2 + (ux / self.a) ** 2
 991        db = 2 * ((uy * yA + uz * zA) / self.b**2 + (ux * xA) / self.a**2)
 992        dc = (yA**2 + zA**2) / self.b**2 + (xA / self.a) ** 2 - 1
 993
 994        Solution = mgeo.SolverQuadratic(da, db, dc)
 995        Solution = mgeo.KeepPositiveSolution(Solution)
 996
 997        ListPointIntersection = []
 998        C = self.get_centre()
 999        for t in Solution:
1000            Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
1001            if Intersect[2] < 0 and self.support._IncludeSupport(
1002                Intersect - C
1003            ):
1004                ListPointIntersection.append(Intersect)
1005
1006        return _IntersectionRayMirror(Ray.point, ListPointIntersection)
1007
1008    def get_local_normal(self, Point):
1009        """Return the normal unit vector on the ellipsoidal surface at point Point."""
1010        Gradient = np.zeros(3)
1011
1012        Gradient[0] = -Point[0] / self.a**2
1013        Gradient[1] = -Point[1] / self.b**2
1014        Gradient[2] = -Point[2] / self.b**2
1015
1016        return mgeo.Normalize(Gradient)
1017
1018    def get_centre(self):
1019        """Return 3D coordinates of the point on the mirror surface at the center of its support."""
1020        foci = 2 * np.sqrt(self.a**2 - self.b**2)
1021        h = -foci / 2 / np.tan(self._offaxisangle)
1022        R = np.sqrt(foci**2 / 4 + h**2)
1023        sign = 1
1024        if math.isclose(self._offaxisangle, np.pi / 2):
1025            h = 0
1026        elif self._offaxisangle > np.pi / 2:
1027            h = -h
1028            sign = -1
1029        a = 1 - self.a**2 / self.b**2
1030        b = -2 * h
1031        c = self.a**2 + h**2 - R**2
1032        z = (-b + sign * np.sqrt(b**2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a)
1033        if math.isclose(z**2, self.b**2):
1034            return np.array([0, 0, -self.b])
1035        x = self.a * np.sqrt(1 - z**2 / self.b**2)
1036        centre = np.array([x, 0, sign * z])
1037        return centre
1038
1039    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
1040        """
1041        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
1042
1043        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
1044        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
1045        """
1046        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
1047        ListCoordXYZ = []
1048        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
1049        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
1050        if E:
1051            contours, contour_edges = contours
1052        ListCoordXY = self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
1053        centre = self.get_centre()
1054        for i, k in enumerate(ListCoordXY):
1055            x = k[0] + centre[0]
1056            y = k[1]
1057            sideways = (x / self.a) ** 2 + (y / self.b) ** 2
1058            if sideways <= 1:
1059                z = -self.b * np.sqrt(1 - sideways)
1060                ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([x, y, z]))
1061        new_contour_edges = []
1062        for j in contour_edges:
1063            new_contour_edges += [[]]
1064            for i in j:
1065                x = contours[i][0] + centre[0]
1066                y = contours[i][1]
1067                sideways = (x / self.a) ** 2 + (y / self.b) ** 2
1068                if sideways <= 1:
1069                    z = -self.b * np.sqrt(1 - sideways)
1070                    ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([x, y, z]))
1071                    new_contour_edges[-1] += [len(ListCoordXYZ) - 1]
1072        if E:
1073            return ListCoordXYZ, new_contour_edges
1074        return ListCoordXYZ
1075
1076
1077# %%
1078def ReturnOptimalEllipsoidalAxes(Focal: float, AngleIncidence: float):
1079    """
1080    Get optimal parameters for an ellipsoidal mirror.
1081
1082    Useful helper function to get the optimal major and minor axes for an ellipsoidal mirror to achieve a
1083    focal length 'Focal' with an angle of incidence 'AngleIncidence'.
1084
1085    Parameters
1086    ----------
1087        Focal : float
1088            Focal length in mm.
1089
1090        AngleIncidence : int
1091            Angle of incidence in degrees.
1092
1093    Returns
1094    -------
1095        OptimalSemiMajorAxis, OptimalSemiMinorAxis : float, float.
1096    """
1097    AngleIncidenceRadian = np.deg2rad(AngleIncidence)
1098    OptimalSemiMajorAxis = Focal
1099    OptimalSemiMinorAxis = OptimalSemiMajorAxis * np.cos(AngleIncidenceRadian)
1100    return OptimalSemiMajorAxis, OptimalSemiMinorAxis

1104class MirrorCylindrical(Mirror):
1105    """
1106    Cylindrical mirror surface with eqn. $y^2 + z^2  = R^2$, where $R$ is the radius.
1107
1108    Attributes
1109    ----------
1110        radius : float
1111            Radius of curvature. A postive value for concave mirror, a negative value for a convex mirror.
1112
1113        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
1114
1115        type : str 'Cylindrical Mirror'.
1116
1117    Methods
1118    -------
1119        MirrorCylindrical.get_normal(Point)
1120
1121        MirrorCylindrical.get_centre()
1122
1123        MirrorCylindrical.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
1124    """
1125
1126    def __init__(self, Radius, Support):
1127        """
1128        Construct a cylindrical mirror.
1129
1130        Parameters
1131        ----------
1132            Radius : float
1133                The radius of curvature in mm. A postive value for concave mirror, a negative value for a convex mirror.
1134
1135            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
1136
1137        """
1138        if Radius < 0:
1139            self.type = "CylindricalCX Mirror"
1140            self.curvature = Curvature.CONVEX
1141            self.radius = -Radius
1142        else:
1143            self.type = "CylindricalCC Mirror"
1144            self.curvature = Curvature.CONCAVE
1145            self.radius = Radius
1146
1147        self.support = Support
1148        self._position = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
1149        self._positionned = False
1150        if "position" in kwargs:
1151            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
1152            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
1153                logger.debug("Defining position of parabolic mirror during creation")
1154                self._position = NewPosition
1155                self._positionned = True
1156        self._orientation = np.quaternion(1)
1157        self._oriented = False
1158        if "orientation" in kwargs:
1159            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
1160            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
1161                logger.debug("Defining orientation of parabolic mirror during creation")
1162                self._orientation = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
1163                self._oriented = True
1164        self.oe_frame_normal = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
1165        self.oe_frame_majoraxis = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
1166        super().__init__()
1167
1168    def __repr__(self):
1169        match type(self.support):
1170            case msup.SupportRound:
1171                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
1172                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, radius of curvature: {self.radius} mm"
1173            case msup.SupportRectangle:
1174                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"
1175                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, radius of curvature: {self.radius} mm"
1176            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
1177                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type}"
1178                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, radius of curvature: {self.radius} mm"
1179            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
1180                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type} with rectangular hole"
1181                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm, radius of curvature: {self.radius} mm"
1182            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
1183                shape = f"Round holey {self.type}"
1184                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, radius of curvature: {self.radius} mm"
1185            case _:
1186                shape = f"{self.type}"
1187                size = "Custom size"
1188        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
1189        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
1190        if self._positionned:
1191            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
1192        else:
1193            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
1194        pretty_str+="\t-"
1195        if self._oriented:
1196            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
1197        else:
1198            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
1199        return pretty_str
1200
1201    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
1202        """Return the intersection point between the Ray and the cylinder."""
1203        uy = Ray.vector[1]
1204        uz = Ray.vector[2]
1205        yA = Ray.point[1]
1206        zA = Ray.point[2]
1207
1208        a = uy**2 + uz**2
1209        b = 2 * (uy * yA + uz * zA)
1210        c = yA**2 + zA**2 - self.radius**2
1211
1212        Solution = mgeo.SolverQuadratic(a, b, c)
1213        Solution = mgeo.KeepPositiveSolution(Solution)
1214
1215        ListPointIntersection = []
1216        for t in Solution:
1217            Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
1218            if Intersect[2] < 0 and self.support._IncludeSupport(Intersect):
1219                ListPointIntersection.append(Intersect)
1220
1221        return _IntersectionRayMirror(Ray.point, ListPointIntersection)
1222
1223    def get_local_normal(self, Point):
1224        """Return the normal unit vector on the cylinder surface at point P."""
1225        Gradient = np.array([0, -Point[1], -Point[2]])
1226        return mgeo.Normalize(Gradient)
1227
1228    def get_centre(self):
1229        """Return 3D coordinates of the point on the mirror surface at the center of its support."""
1230        return np.array([0, 0, -self.radius])
1231
1232    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
1233        """
1234        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
1235
1236        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
1237        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
1238        """
1239        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
1240        ListCoordXYZ = []
1241        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
1242        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
1243        if E:
1244            contours, contour_edges = contours
1245        ListCoordXY = contours + self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
1246        for k in ListCoordXY:
1247            z = -np.sqrt(self.radius**2 - k[1] ** 2)
1248            ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([k[0], k[1], z]))
1249        if E:
1250            return ListCoordXYZ, contour_edges
1251        return ListCoordXYZ
1252
1253
1254# %%############################################################################
1255def _ReflectionMirrorRay(Mirror, PointMirror, Ray):
1256    """
1257    Return the reflected ray according to the law of reflection.
1258
1259    Parameters
1260    ----------
1261        Mirror : Mirror-objectS
1262
1263        PointMirror : np.ndarray
1264            Point of reflection on the mirror surface.
1265
1266        Ray : Ray-object
1267
1268    """
1269    PointRay = Ray.point
1270    VectorRay = Ray.vector
1271    NormalMirror = Mirror.get_local_normal(PointMirror)
1272
1273    #VectorRayReflected = mgeo.SymmetricalVector(-VectorRay, NormalMirror)
1274    VectorRayReflected = VectorRay- 2*NormalMirror*np.dot(VectorRay,NormalMirror) # Is it any better than SymmetricalVector?
1275
1276    RayReflected = Ray.copy_ray()
1277    RayReflected.point = PointMirror
1278    RayReflected.vector = VectorRayReflected
1279    RayReflected.incidence = mgeo.AngleBetweenTwoVectors(
1280    -VectorRay, NormalMirror
1281    )
1282    RayReflected.path = Ray.path + (np.linalg.norm(PointMirror - PointRay),)
1283
1284    return RayReflected
1285
1286

1289
1290def ReflectionMirrorRayList(Mirror, ListRay, IgnoreDefects=False):
1291    """
1292    Return the the reflected rays according to the law of reflection for the list of incident rays ListRay.
1293
1294    Rays that do not hit the support are not further propagated.
1295
1296    Updates the reflected rays' incidence angle and path.
1297
1298    Parameters
1299    ----------
1300        Mirror : Mirror-object
1301
1302        ListRay : list[Ray-object]
1303
1304    """
1305    Deformed = type(Mirror) == DeformedMirror
1306    ListRayReflected = []
1307    for k in ListRay:
1308        PointMirror = Mirror._get_intersection(k)
1309
1310        if PointMirror is not None:
1311            if Deformed and IgnoreDefects:
1312                M = Mirror.Mirror
1313            else:
1314                M = Mirror
1315            RayReflected = _ReflectionMirrorRay(M, PointMirror, k)
1316            ListRayReflected.append(RayReflected)
1317    return ListRayReflected
1318

1323class DeformedMirror(Mirror):
1324    def __init__(self, Mirror, DeformationList):
1325        self.Mirror = Mirror
1326        self.DeformationList = DeformationList
1327        self.type = Mirror.type
1328        self.support = self.Mirror.support
1329
1330    def get_local_normal(self, PointMirror):
1331        base_normal = self.Mirror.get_normal(PointMirror)
1332        C = self.get_centre()
1333        defects_normals = [
1334            d.get_normal(PointMirror - C) for d in self.DeformationList
1335        ]
1336        for i in defects_normals:
1337            base_normal = mgeo.normal_add(base_normal, i)
1338            base_normal /= np.linalg.norm(base_normal)
1339        return base_normal
1340
1341    def get_centre(self):
1342        return self.Mirror.get_centre()
1343
1344    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
1345        return self.Mirror.get_grid3D(NbPoint, **kwargs)
1346
1347    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
1348        Intersect = self.Mirror._get_intersection(Ray)
1349        if Intersect is not None:
1350            h = sum(
1351                D.get_offset(Intersect - self.get_centre())
1352                for D in self.DeformationList
1353            )
1354            alpha = mgeo.AngleBetweenTwoVectors(
1355                -Ray.vector, self.Mirror.get_normal(Intersect)
1356            )
1357            Intersect -= Ray.vector * h / np.cos(alpha)
1358        return Intersect

1363class OAP_calculator(DepSolver):
1364    def __init__(self):
1365        self.nodes = ['fp', 'fs', 'theta', 'Rc', 'OAD', 'p']
1366        self.functions = {
1367            ('fs',): [
1368                (['fp', 'theta'], self.fs_fptheta)
1369            ],
1370            ('fp',): [
1371                (['Rc'], self.fp_Rc),
1372                (['fs', 'theta'], self.fp_fstheta)
1373            ],
1374            ('Rc',): [
1375                (['fp'], self.Rc_fp),
1376            ],
1377            ('OAD',): [
1378                (['fs', 'theta'], self.OAD_fstheta),
1379            ],
1380            ('theta',):[
1381                (['OAD', 'fp'], self.theta_OADfp),
1382                (['OAD', 'fs'], self.theta_OADfs)
1383            ],
1384            ('p',):[
1385                (['fs', 'theta'], lambda fs, theta: fs*(1+np.cos(np.deg2rad(theta))))
1386            ]
1387        }
1388        super().__init__(self.nodes, self.functions)
1389
1390    def fs_fptheta(self, fp, theta):
1391        return 2 * fp / (1 + np.cos(np.deg2rad(theta)))
1392
1393    def fp_Rc(self, Rc):
1394        return Rc / 2
1395
1396    def Rc_fp(self, fp):
1397        return 2 * fp
1398
1399    def OAD_fstheta(self, fs, theta):
1400        return fs * np.sin(np.deg2rad(theta))
1401
1402    def theta_OADfp(self, OAD, fp):
1403        return np.rad2deg(np.arctan(OAD / (2 * fp)) * 2)
1404
1405    def theta_OADfs(self, OAD, fs):
1406        return np.rad2deg(np.arcsin(OAD / fs))
1407
1408    def fp_fstheta(self, fs, theta):
1409        return (1 + np.cos(np.deg2rad(theta))) * fs / 2

1412class EllipsoidalMirrorCalculator(DepSolver):
1413    def __init__(self):
1414        self.nodes = ['m',
1415                      'f1',
1416                      'f2',
1417                      'offset_angle',
1418                      'incidence_angle',

1426                (['f1', 'f2'], self.m_f1f2)

1428            ('f1',): [
1429                (['f2', 'm'], self.f1_f2m),
1430                (['a', 'f2'], self.f1_af2),
1431            ],
1432            ('f2',): [
1433                (['f1', 'm'], self.f2_f1m),
1434                (['a', 'f1'], self.f2_af1)
1435            ],
1436            ('a',): [
1437                (['f1', 'f2'], self.a_f1f2),
1438                (['b', 'c'], self.a_bc)
1439            ],
1440            ('b',): [
1441                (['a', 'c'], self.b_ac),
1442                (['a', 'e'], self.b_ae),
1443            ],
1444            ('incidence_angle',): [
1445                (['f2','offset_angle', 'c'], self.incidenceangle_f2offsetc)
1446            ],
1447            ('e',): [
1448                (['a', 'b'], self.e_ab),
1449                (['a', 'c'], self.e_ac)
1450            ],
1451            ('c',): [
1452                (['a', 'e'], self.c_ae),
1453                (['a', 'b'], self.c_ab),
1454                (['f1', 'f2', 'offset_angle'],self.c_f1f2offset)
1455            ],
1456            ('l',):[
1457                (['b','a'], lambda a,b:b**2/a),
1458            ],
1459            ('offset_angle',): [
1460                (['c', 'f1', 'f2'], self.offset_cf1f2),
1461            ],
1462            ('f1','f2'): [
1463                (['a', 'c', 'offset_angle'], self.f1f2_acoffset),
1464            ]
1465        }
1466        super().__init__(self.nodes, self.functions)

1468    def c_ae(self, a, e):
1469        return a*e
1470
1471    def e_ac(self, a, c):
1472        return c/a
1473
1474    def e_ab(self, a, b):
1475        return np.sqrt(1-b**2/a**2)
1476
1477    def b_ae(self, a, e):
1478        return a*np.sqrt(1 - e**2)
1479
1480    def c_ab(self, a,b):
1481        return np.sqrt(a**2-b**2)
1482
1483    def c_f1f2offset(self,f1,f2, offset_angle):
1484        return np.sqrt((f1**2 + f2**2 - 2*f1*f2*np.cos(np.deg2rad(offset_angle))))/2
1485
1486    def m_f1f2(self, f1, f2):
1487        return f2 / f1
1488
1489    def f1_f2m(self, f2, m):
1490        return f2 / m
1491
1492    def f2_f1m(self, f1, m):
1493        return f1 * m
1494
1495    def a_f1f2(self, f1, f2):
1496        return (f1 + f2)/2
1497
1498    def f1_af2(self, a, f2):
1499        return 2*a-f2
1500
1501    def f2_af1(self, a, f1):
1502        return 2*a-f1
1503
1504    def b_ac(self, a, c):
1505        return np.sqrt(a**2-c**2)
1506
1507    def a_bc(self, b, c):
1508        return np.sqrt(b**2 + c**2)
1509
1510    def incidenceangle_f2offsetc(self, f2, offset_angle, c):
1511        return 180-offset_angle-np.rad2deg(np.arcsin(f2/(2*c)*np.sin(np.deg2rad(offset_angle))))
1512
1513    def offset_cf1f2(self, c, f1, f2):
1514        return np.rad2deg(np.arccos((-(2*c)**2 + f1**2 + f2**2)/(2*f1*f2)))
1515
1516    def f1f2_acoffset(self, a, c, offset_angle):
1517        delta = (2*a)**2 - 2*((2*a)**2 - (2*c)**2)/(1+np.cos(np.deg2rad(offset_angle)))
1518        f1 = (2*a+np.sqrt(delta))/2
1519        f2 = (2*a-np.sqrt(delta))/2
1520        logger.warn("No way to distinguish f1 and f2, picking f1>f2")
1521        return f1, f2

 76class MirrorPlane(Mirror):
 77    """
 78    A plane mirror.
 79
 80    Attributes
 81    ----------
 82        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
 83            Mirror support
 84        type : str = 'Plane Mirror'
 85            Human readable mirror type
 86    Methods

 90        MirrorPlane.get_centre()
 91
 92        MirrorPlane.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
 93    """
 94
 95    def __init__(self, Support, **kwargs):
 96        """
 97        Create a plane mirror on a given Support.
 98
 99        Parameters
100        ----------
101            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
102
103        """
104        self.support = Support
105        self.type = "Plane Mirror"
106        self.curvature = Curvature.FLAT
107
108        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
109        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
110
111        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
112        self.centre_ref = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
113        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
114        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
115
116        self._positionned = False
117        self._oriented = False
118        if "position" in kwargs:
119            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
120            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
121                logger.debug("Defining position of plane mirror during creation")
122                self._r = NewPosition - self._basepoint_ref
123                self._positionned = True
124        if "orientation" in kwargs:
125            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
126            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
127                logger.debug("Defining orientation of plane mirror during creation")
128                self._q = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
129                self._oriented = True
130        super().__init__()
131        
132    def __repr__(self):
133        match type(self.support):
134            case msup.SupportRound:
135                shape = "Round Plane Mirror"
136                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius}"
137            case msup.SupportRectangle:
138                shape = "Rectangular Plane Mirror"
139                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY}"
140            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
141                shape = "Rectangular holey Plane Mirror"
142                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY}, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole}"
143            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
144                shape = "Rectangular holey Plane Mirror with rectangular hole"
145                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY}, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY}"
146            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
147                shape = "Round holey Plane Mirror"
148                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius}, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole}"
149            case _:
150                shape = "Plane Mirror"
151        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
152        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
153        if self._positionned:
154            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
155        else:
156            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
157        pretty_str+="\t-"
158        if self._oriented:
159            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
160        else:
161            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
162        return pretty_str

164    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
165        """Return the intersection point between Ray and the xy-plane."""
166        t = -Ray.point[2] / Ray.vector[2]
167        Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point

170        else:

class MirrorSpherical(Mirror): 
208class MirrorSpherical(Mirror):
209    """
210    Spherical mirror surface with eqn. $x^2 + y^2 + z^2  = R^2$, where $R$ is the radius.
211
212    ![Illustration of a spherical mirror.](sphericalmirror.svg)
213
214    Attributes
215    ----------
216        radius : float
217            Radius of curvature. A postive value for concave mirror, a negative value for a convex mirror.
218
219        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
220
221        type : str SphericalCC Mirror' or SphericalCX Mirror'
222
223    Methods
224    -------
225        MirrorSpherical.get_normal(Point)
226
227        MirrorSpherical.get_centre()
228
229        MirrorSpherical.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
230
231    """
232
233    def __init__(self, Support, Radius, **kwargs):
234        """
235        Construct a spherical mirror.
236
237        Parameters
238        ----------
239            Radius : float
240                The radius of curvature in mm. A postive value for concave mirror, a negative value for a convex mirror.
241
242            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
243
244        """
245        if Radius==np.inf or Radius==-np.inf:
246            logger.info("Requested spherical mirror has infinite radius, using MirrorPlane instead.")
247            return MirrorPlane(Support, **kwargs)
248        elif Radius < 0:
249            self.type = "SphericalCX Mirror"
250            self.curvature = Curvature.CONVEX
251            self.radius = -Radius
252        else:
253            self.type = "SphericalCC Mirror"
254            self.curvature = Curvature.CONCAVE
255            self.radius = Radius
256        self.support = Support
257
258        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
259        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
260
261        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.radius])
262        self.centre_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.radius])
263        self.sphere_center_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, 0])
264        self.focus_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.radius/2])
265
266        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
267        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
268        self.towards_focus_ref = mgeo.Normalize(self.focus_ref - self.centre_ref)
269
270        self._oriented = False
271        self._positionned = False
272        if "position" in kwargs:
273            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
274            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
275                logger.debug("Defining position of spherical mirror during creation")
276                self._r = NewPosition - self._basepoint_ref
277                self._positionned = True
278        if "orientation" in kwargs:
279            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
280            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
281                logger.debug("Defining orientation of spherical mirror during creation")
282                self._q = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
283                self._oriented = True
284        super().__init__()
285
286    def __repr__(self):
287        match type(self.support):
288            case msup.SupportRound:
289                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
290                size = f"Support Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, ROC: {self.radius}"
291            case msup.SupportRectangle:
292                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"
293                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm"
294            case msup.SupportRectangleHole:
295                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type}"
296                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm"
297            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:
298                shape = f"Rectangular holey {self.type} with rectangular hole"
299                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm"
300            case msup.SupportRoundHole:
301                shape = f"Round holey {self.type}"
302                size = f"Support Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, hole radius: {self.support.radiushole} mm, , ROC: {self.radius}"
303            case _:
304                shape = f"{self.type}"
305                size = "Custom size"
306        pretty_str = f"{shape}\n"
307        pretty_str+= f"\t-{size}\n\t-"
308        if self._positionned:
309            pretty_str+=f"Position: {self.position}\n"
310        else:
311            pretty_str+="Not positionned\n"
312        pretty_str+="\t-"
313        if self._oriented:
314            pretty_str+=f"Orientation: {self.orientation}\n"
315        else:
316            pretty_str+="Not oriented\n"
317        return pretty_str
318
319    def _get_intersection(self, Ray):
320        """Return the intersection point between the ray and the sphere."""
321        a = np.dot(Ray.vector, Ray.vector)
322        b = 2 * np.dot(Ray.vector, Ray.point)
323        c = np.dot(Ray.point, Ray.point) - self.radius**2
324
325        Solution = mgeo.SolverQuadratic(a, b, c)
326        Solution = mgeo.KeepPositiveSolution(Solution)
327
328        ListPointIntersection = []
329        for t in Solution:
330            Intersect = Ray.vector * t + Ray.point
331            if Intersect[2] < 0 and self.support._IncludeSupport(Intersect):
332                ListPointIntersection.append(Intersect)
333
334        return _IntersectionRayMirror(Ray.point, ListPointIntersection)
335
336    def get_local_normal(self, Point):
337        """Return the normal unit vector on the spherical surface at point Point."""
338        return mgeo.Normalize(-Point)
339
340    def get_centre(self):
341        """Return 3D coordinates of the point on the mirror surface at the center of its support."""
342        return np.array([0, 0, -self.radius])
343
344    def get_grid3D(self, NbPoint, **kwargs):
345        """
346        Get grid of points on mirror surface.
347
348        Returns list of numpy-arrays containing the 3D-coordinates of points in the mirror surface,
349        sampling the support in a number NbPoints of points.
350        """
351        E = "edges" in kwargs and kwargs["edges"]
352        ListCoordXYZ = []
353        contour = int(round(0.1 * NbPoint))
354        contours = self.support._Contour_points(contour, **kwargs)
355        if E:
356            contours, contour_edges = contours
357        ListCoordXY = contours + self.support._get_grid(NbPoint - contour)
358        for k in ListCoordXY:
359            z = -np.sqrt(self.radius**2 - (k[0] ** 2 + k[1] ** 2))
360            ListCoordXYZ.append(np.array([k[0], k[1], z]))
361        if E:
362            return ListCoordXYZ, contour_edges
363        return ListCoordXYZ

class MirrorParabolic(Mirror): 
367class MirrorParabolic(Mirror):
368    r"""
369    A paraboloid with vertex at the origin $O=[0,0,0]$ and symmetry axis z:
370    $z = \frac{1}{4f}[x^2 + y^2]$ where $f$ is the focal lenght of the *mother*
371    parabola (i.e. measured from its center at $O$ to the focal point $F$).
372
373    The center of the support is shifted along the x-direction by the off-axis distance $x_c$.
374    This leads to an *effective focal length* $f_\mathrm{eff}$, measured from the shifted center
375    of the support  $P$ to the focal point $F$.
376    It is related to the mother focal length by $f = f_\\mathrm{eff} \cos^2(\alpha/2) $,
377    or equivalently $ p = 2f = f_\mathrm{eff} (1+\\cos\\alpha)$, where $\\alpha$
378    is the off-axis angle, and $p = 2f$ is called the semi latus rectum.
379
380    Another useful relationship is that between the off-axis distance and the resulting
381    off-axis angle: $x_c = 2 f \tan(\alpha/2)$.
382
383
384    ![Illustration of a parabolic mirror.](parabola.svg)
385
386    Attributes
387    ----------
388        offaxisangle : float
389            Off-axis angle of the parabola. Modifying this also updates p, keeping feff constant.
390            Attention: The off-axis angle must be *given in degrees*, but is stored and will be *returned in radian* !
391
392        feff : float
393            Effective focal length of the parabola in mm. Modifying this also updates p, keeping offaxisangle constant.
394
395        p : float
396            Semi latus rectum of the parabola in mm. Modifying this also updates feff, keeping offaxisangle constant.
397
398        support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
399
400        type : str 'Parabolic Mirror'.
401
402    Methods
403    -------
404        MirrorParabolic.get_normal(Point)
405
406        MirrorParabolic.get_centre()
407
408        MirrorParabolic.get_grid3D(NbPoints)
409
410    """
411
412    def __init__(self, Support,
413                FocalEffective: float=None,
414                OffAxisAngle: float = None,
415                FocalParent: float = None,
416                RadiusParent: float = None,
417                OffAxisDistance: float = None,
418                **kwargs):
419        """
420        Initialise a Parabolic mirror.
421
422        Parameters
423        ----------
424            FocalEffective : float
425                Effective focal length of the parabola in mm.
426
427            OffAxisAngle : float
428                Off-axis angle *in degrees* of the parabola.
429
430            Support : ART.ModuleSupport.Support
431
432        """
433        if FocalEffective==np.inf or FocalEffective==-np.inf:
434            logger.info("Requested parabolic mirror has infinite focal, using MirrorPlane instead.")
435            return MirrorPlane(Support, **kwargs)
436        
437        self.curvature = Curvature.CONCAVE
438        self.support = Support
439        self.type = "Parabolic Mirror"
440
441        parameter_calculator = OAP_calculator()
442        values,steps = parameter_calculator.calculate_values(verify_consistency=True,
443                                                             fs=FocalEffective,
444                                                             theta=OffAxisAngle,
445                                                             fp=FocalParent,
446                                                             Rc=RadiusParent,
447                                                             OAD=OffAxisDistance)
448        self._offaxisangle = values["theta"]
449        self._feff = values["fs"]
450        self._p = values["p"]
451        self._offaxisdistance = values["OAD"]
452        self._fparent = values["fp"]
453        self._rparent = values["Rc"]
454
455        self._r = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 0.0])
456        """Offset of the basepoint."""
457        self._q = np.quaternion(1)
458        """Orientation of the mirror."""
459
460        self.basepoint_ref = np.array([-self._offaxisdistance, 0, self._p/2 - self.feff * np.cos(self.offaxisangle)])
461        """Basepoint of the mirror in its own reference frame. Corresponds to its optical center"""
462        self.centre_ref = np.array([-self._offaxisdistance, 0, self._p/2 - self.feff * np.cos(self.offaxisangle)])
463        """Optical center of the mirror"""
464        self.focus_ref = np.array([0.0, 0, -self.feff])
465        """Focus of the mirror in its own reference frame."""
466        self.along_focusing_ref = mgeo.Normalize(self.focus_ref-self.centre_ref)
467        """Unit vector along the focusing direction in the mirror reference frame."""
468        self.along_collimated_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
469        """Unit vector along the collimated direction in the mirror reference frame."""
470        self.support_normal_ref = np.array([0, 0, 1.0])
471        """Normal vector of the support in the mirror reference frame."""
472        self.majoraxis_ref = np.array([1.0, 0, 0])
473        """Major axis of the mirror in the mirror reference frame."""
474        
475        self._oriented = False
476        """Is the mirror oriented?"""
477        self._positionned = False
478        """Is the mirror positionned?"""
479
480        if "position" in kwargs:
481            NewPosition = kwargs["position"]
482            if type(NewPosition) == np.ndarray and len(NewPosition) == 3:
483                logger.debug("Defining position of plane mirror during creation")
484                self._r = NewPosition - self._basepoint_ref
485                self._positionned = True
486        if "orientation" in kwargs:
487            NewOrientation = kwargs["orientation"]
488            if type(NewOrientation) == np.quaternion:
489                logger.debug("Defining orientation of plane mirror during creation")
490                self._q = np.normalized(NewOrientation)
491                self._oriented = True
492        super().__init__()

497            case msup.SupportRound:
498                shape = f"Round {self.type}"
499                size = f"Radius: {self.support.radius} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"
500            case msup.SupportRectangle:
501                shape = f"Rectangular {self.type}"

506            case msup.SupportRectangleRectHole:

508                size = f"Size: {self.support.dimX} x {self.support.dimY} mm, hole size: {self.support.holeX} x {self.support.holeY} mm, effective focal length: {self._feff} mm"

512            case _:

528    @property
529    def offaxisangle(self):

531
532    @offaxisangle.setter
533    def offaxisangle(self, OffAxisAngle):
534        self._offaxisangle = np.deg2rad(OffAxisAngle)  # store (and later return) in radians!
535        self._p = self._feff * (1 + np.cos(self._offaxisangle))  # make sure to always update p
536
537    @property
538    def feff(self):
539        """Get effective focal length."""
540        return self._feff
541
542    @feff.setter
543    def feff(self, FocalEffective):
544        self._feff = FocalEffective
545        self._p = self._feff * (
546            1 + np.cos(self._offaxisangle)
547        )  # make sure to always update p
548
549    @property
550    def p(self):
551        """Get simi-latus-rectum."""
552        return self._p
553
554    @p.setter
555    def p(self, SemiLatusRectum):
556        self._p = SemiLatusRectum
557        self._feff = self._p / (
558            1 + np.cos(self._offaxisangle)
559        )  # make sure to always update feff
